problem.p: A bag contains 5 red balls and 3 blue balls.

ul.li: Pick one ball at random, and let \(X\) be the random color. What is the size of the sample space?
Two red-or-blue balls are added to the original 8-ball bag. If \(P(X = \text{blue})\) is now \(0.4\), how many of the two balls were blue?
Two balls are removed from the original 8-ball bag, resulting \(P(X = \text{blue})=0.5\). How many of the two balls were blue?
